prompt.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to make someone decide to do something
prompt.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: What prompted you to buy that suit?
prompt.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to make people say or do something as a reaction
prompt.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The decision prompted an outcry among prominent US campaigners.
prompt.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to help a speaker who pauses, by suggesting how to continue
prompt.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: ‘I can’t decide, ’ said Beatrice. ‘Decide what?’ prompted Marlon.
prompt.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to ask someone to do something on a computer
prompt.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: A message will appear which will prompt you for certain information.
prompt.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to remind an actor of the next words in a speech
prompt.translation[1].definitions[0].def: done quickly, immediately, or at the right time
prompt.translation[1].definitions[1].def: someone who is prompt arrives or does something at the right time and is not late
prompt.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Lunch is at two. Try to be prompt.
prompt.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a word or words said to an actor in a play, to help them remember what to say
prompt.translation[2].definitions[1].def: a sign on a computer screen which shows that the computer has finished one operation and is ready to begin the next
prompt.translation[3].definitions[0].def: at the time mentioned and no later
prompt.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: The bus will leave at 8 o'clock prompt.
prompt.translation[4].definitions[0].def: done quickly, immediately, or at the right time
prompt.translation[4].definitions[0].exa: We guarantee prompt delivery of your purchases.
Many customers are taking advantage of a 2.5% discount for prompt payment.
prompt.translation[5].definitions[0].def: a sign on a computer screen which shows that the computer has finished one operation and is ready to begin the next
prompt.translation[5].definitions[0].exa: When you see the ‘C’ prompt, type ‘WP’.
